content: शप् A technical term used by Pāṇini for the conjugational sign अ inserted between the root and the terminations of the conjugational tenses in the first class of roots.
शप् {%<ab>ind.</ab>%} A particle and prefix implying assent or compliance.

शप् {c1c} {c4c} <ab>U.</ab> (शपति-ते, शप्यति-ते, शप्त) {@--1@} To curse, execrate; अशपद्भव मानुषीति तां <ls>R. 8. 80</ls>; सोऽभूत्परासुरथ भूमिपतिं शशाप (वृद्धः) <ls n="R.">9. 78</ls>, <ls n="R.">1. 77.</ls> {@--2@} To swear, take an oath, promise by oath, say on oath, (usually with <ab>dat.</ab> of the person to whom a promise &c. is made and <ab>instr.</ab> of the object by which it is made); भरतेनात्पना चाहं शपे ते मनुजाधिप . यथा नान्येन तुष्येयमृते रामविवासनात् Rām; when used without an object it generally governs the <ab>instr.</ab> of the thing and <ab>dat.</ab> of the person by which or whom the oath is taken; सत्यं शपामि ने पादपंकजस्पर्शेन <ls>K.</ls>; <ls>Ghaṭ. 22</ls>; अशप्त निह्नुवानाऽसौ सीतायै स्मरमोहितः <ls>Bk. 8. 74</ls>; प्रेम जिज्ञासमानाब्यस्ताब्योऽशप्सत कामिनः <ls n="Bk.">8. 33</ls>; sometimes शप् governs a cognate accusative सहत्रशोऽसौ शपथानशप्यत् <ls>Bk. 3. 32.</ls> {@--3@} To blame, scold, revile, abuse (with dat or by itself); द्विषद्भ्यश्चाशपस्तया <ls>Bk. 17. 4.</ls> प्रतिवाचमदत्त केशवः शपमानाय न चेदिभूभुजे <ls>Śi. 16 25.</ls> {%--<ab>Caus.</ab>%} (शापयति-ते) To bind by an oath, conjure; शापितोऽसि गोब्राह्मणकाम्यया <ls>Mk. 3</ls>; शापितासि मम लवंगिकावलोकितयोश्व जीवितेन यदि वाचा न कथयसि <ls>Māl. 8.</ls>
